42/*
43 * Unmounting filesystems under BSD 4.4.
44 */
45
46#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
47# include <config.h>
48#endif /* HAVE_CONFIG_H */
49#include <am_defs.h>
50#include <amu.h>
51
52
53int
54umount_fs(char *mntdir, const char *mnttabname, u_int unmount_flags)
55{
56 int error;
57
58eintr:
59 error = unmount(mntdir, 0);
60 if (error < 0)
61 error = errno;
62
63 switch (error) {
64 case EINVAL:
65 case ENOTBLK:
66 case ENOENT:
67 plog(XLOG_WARNING, "unmount: %s is not mounted", mntdir);
68 error = 0; /* Not really an error */
69 break;
70
71 case EINTR:
72 /* not sure why this happens, but it does. ask kirk one day... */
73 dlog("%s: unmount: %m", mntdir);
74 goto eintr;
75
76#ifdef MNT2_GEN_OPT_FORCE
77 case EBUSY:
78 case EIO:
79 case ESTALE:
80 /* caller determines if forced unmounts should be used */
81 if (unmount_flags & AMU_UMOUNT_FORCE) {
82 error = umount2_fs(mntdir, unmount_flags);
83 if (error < 0)
84 error = errno;
85 else
86 return error;
87 }
88 /* fallthrough */
89#endif /* MNT2_GEN_OPT_FORCE */
90
91 default:
92 dlog("%s: unmount: %m", mntdir);
93 break;
94 }
95
96 return error;
97}
98
99
100#ifdef MNT2_GEN_OPT_FORCE
101/* force unmount, no questions asked, without touching mnttab file */
102int
103umount2_fs(const char *mntdir, u_int unmount_flags)
104{
105 int error = 0;
106
107 if (unmount_flags & AMU_UMOUNT_FORCE) {
108 plog(XLOG_INFO, "umount2_fs: trying unmount/forced on %s", mntdir);
109 error = unmount(mntdir, MNT2_GEN_OPT_FORCE);
110 if (error < 0 && (errno == EINVAL || errno == ENOENT))
111 error = 0; /* ignore EINVAL/ENOENT */
112 if (error < 0)
113 plog(XLOG_WARNING, "%s: unmount/force: %m", mntdir);
114 else
115 dlog("%s: unmount/force: OK", mntdir);
116 }
117 return error;
118}
119#endif /* MNT2_GEN_OPT_FORCE */
120
